page.title: 19St. Edith's Well
page.content: Edith was born in Kemsing in A.D.901, the daughter of King Edgar and Lady Wulfrith. She lived most of her short life as a nun in Wilton. When she died in A.D.984 there were reports of miracles. These claims were examined and she was canonised.. Her feast is Sept. 16th. In the Middle Ages a cult grew in Kemsing and a atatue was erected in the Churchyard. Pilgrims stopped here en route to Canterbury. Her emblems are a wheatsheaf and a goblet of water representing powers of curing diseases of corn, and curative powers of water. In the 16th. century the shrine was demolished but the well well remains.
